text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Rajesh a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Dublin today I'm going to show you how
to restrict access to your Amazon API
Gateway from specific Source IP address
ranges let's get
started in this demonstration I'm going
to use the pet store API as an example
after you sign in to the AWS Management
console navigate to the API Gateway
console choose API Gateway and then
select your API in this case I'm
selecting pet store to restrict access
to your API you must create a resource
policy that defines who can access it
you can also update an existing resource
policy if you already have one to create
the resource policy choose resource
policy
this is the example resource policy that
I'm using for the demonstration this
resource policy includes a deny rule
that denies all traffic entering the API
except for the IP address that you want
to maintain access to save the resource
policy I'm going to choose save
changes next redeploy the API and then
save the curl command for testing
to test whether the Restriction works I
have launched two Amazon elastic compute
Cloud e to instances with two different
public IP addresses
the ec2 instance on the left is
permitted to access the API Gateway and
the instance on the right is denied
access let's go ahead and invoke the API
Gateway from the instance on the
left in the curl command I'm going to
use the invoke URL that I generated when
I deployed the API Gateway as expected
it returns a 200 status code now let's
try the instance on the right
as expected it fails to invoke the API
Gateway and returns a 403 Forbidden
status
code and now you know how to restrict
access to your API Gateway from specific
Source IP address
ranges thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
